title: Temporary Fulfillment and Receiving Associate
description:
The Albert C. Wiltshire Employment Center recruits qualified candidates for positions within the Brooklyn Navy Yard, a 300-acre industrial park housing over 400+ businesses within the manufacturing, food, media, technology, and creative fields.

A Brooklyn Navy Yard-based clothing and accessories fashion design studio is currently seeking a **part-time temporary Fulfillment and Receiving Associate**.

**Job Summary**

We are looking for an enthusiastic and detail-oriented, part time temporary fulfillment and receiving associate for 10-20 hrs a week. Potential for additional hours in peak holiday times.

Options to work Mondays-Saturdays.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

*Fulfillment*

* Pick and pack outgoing orders
* Utilize our shipping platform to fulfill orders
* Build shipping boxes
* Conduct rotating inventory checks on current products
* Check and document the work of others according to established guidelines
* Conduct quality control checks on outbound and inbound products
* Recognize and reconcile inventory discrepancies and report and communicate about it both internally and externally
* Prepare and track daily, weekly and monthly metrics as assigned
* Utilize technology platforms (including, but not limited to Loop, Gorgias, Google)
* Communicate with customers regarding issues related to fulfillment

*Receiving*

* Organize the product in the warehouse and maintain a clean and safe work environment
* Complete inventory counts and organizing inventory in incoming goods
* Maintain organized and accurate records
* Breaking down packaging materials and disposing of them afterwards
* Lifting and organizing boxes (occasionally up to ~100 lbs, anything over 50 lbs should be a team lift)
* Assist in the processing of bulk production shipment

*Returns*

* Manage and process returned inventory and restock once it is processed
* Collect packages from the central mail area
* Label and sort return packages upon their arrival
* Use our returns platform to confirm the content, check for damages and restock when applicable
* Process the returned goods, steaming, folding, repackaging, and placing back into inventory

**Skills include, but are not limited to:**

* 1-2 years of proven shipping and fulfillment experience
* Proficient with MS Office Suite, able to navigate Ship Station and other shipping web platforms
* Basic math skills and professional verbal/written communication skills
* Motivated, self-starter with excellent work ethic
* Must be highly efficient and detail oriented

**Benefits**

* PTO
* 50% Discount on all brand products during time of employment
* $300 in brand merchandise per quarter, during time of employment
* Experience in a growing e-commerce startup, growth opportunities
* Flexible schedule
* Mission driven company with goal to empower the LGBTQ+ community
* Growth opportunities within the company (marketing, customer service, operations, etc)

**Salary Band**

* $20-22/hr

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary

Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Paid time off

Work Location: In person

title: Vice President, Development
company: New York City Economic Development Corporation
description:
**Our Vision**: To make New York City the global model for inclusive innovation and economic growth, fueled by the City's diverse people and businesses.



**Our Mission**: Creating a vibrant, inclusive, and globally competitive economy for all New Yorkers.


**Department Overview****:** NYCEDC's Asset Management Division manages 65 million square feet of real estate properties and non-traditional assets across all five boroughs of New York City including commercial and industrial real estate properties as well as transportation, critical infrastructure, and energy assets. The division pursues a triple-bottom line strategy, targeting economic returns and multiple social metrics including job creation, and growing equitable neighborhoods; as well as ensuring a thoughtful approach to incorporating sustainable and resilient measures. The division-wide portfolio encompasses a wide variety of property types, including Retail, Mixed-Use/Commercial, Industrial, Transportation assets including Cruise, Freight/Rail, and Aviation, and Cultural assets.



The Development department within the Asset Management division works with the portfolio and asset managers to identify opportunities for the redevelopment and/or repositioning of these assets to both improve the economic returns of the assets and to incorporate EDC's strategic policy initiative directives. Current focus areas include the Manhattan Cruise Terminal, the Sunset Park campus (including the Brooklyn Army Terminal and Made in New York Campus), the Teleport Campus, the Brooklyn Marine Terminal, and the Hunts Point Food Market.


**Position Overview:** The VP, Development will be a key member of the Development team. This role involves managing a team responsible for guiding projects through all phases of the development process, from master planning and site planning to financial analysis, design, and construction oversight. The VP will work across departments within Asset Management, including Portfolio Management, Ports, Waterfront and Transportation, Operations, Strategic Analytics, Energy, and Design and Construction. The VP will also work across EDC divisions, including Planning, Real Estate Transactions, Legal, Government and Community Relations, and Finance.


**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**


* Draft requests for proposals and manage procurement processes for development consultants including planners, architects, engineers, financial analysts and construction management.
* Build and maintain detailed financial models of potential redevelopment projects.
* Direct financial structuring analysis (NPV, IRR, COC, etc.) to isolate key drivers of investment return.
* Collaborate with colleagues in other departments in NYCEDC such as Legal, to ensure seamless project execution.
* Provide strategic direction, problem solving, and coordination for multi-disciplinary teams engaged in large-scale planning for redevelopment efforts.
* Demonstrate managerial experience/ability with specific focus on ability to lead and motivate teams to set and meet goals, expectations and deadlines with limited oversight.
* Contribute to the development of the NYCEDC Asset Management revenue diversification strategy which includes P&L management, budgeting, site identification, capital investment, property marketing material needs, project timelines, etc.
* Prepare updates for senior leadership and City Hall that effectively communicate project progress, purpose, challenges, context and next steps.
* Mentor and cultivate junior staff knowledge and skills development.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Master's degree or equivalent in Urban Planning, Real Estate, Business Administration, Public Policy, or a related field preferred.
* 7-10 years of experience in urban planning, real estate development, city government, asset management, or a related field.
* Familiarity with urban development, economic development, financial modeling, real estate research, real estate transactions, leases and contracts of sale.
* An independent and strategic thinker with an entrepreneurial approach to work.
* Demonstrated written and oral communication skills including public speaking.
* Proven project management skills, including the ability to prioritize competing needs and opportunities, and manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail.
* Self-motivated and a self-starter with demonstrated enthusiasm, working effectively both independently and as part of a team.
* Familiarity with NYC government processes, especially land use entitlements.
* Proficient in MS Office, including Word, Power Point, Excel.
* Strong sense of professional judgement and the ability to solve problems creatively.
* New York City residence is required within 180 days of hire.


**About Us**: New York City Economic Development Corporation is a mission-driven, nonprofit organization that works for a vibrant, inclusive, and globally competitive economy for all New Yorkers. We take a comprehensive approach, through four main strategies: strengthen confidence in NYC as a great place to do business; grow innovative sectors, with a focus on equity; build neighborhoods as places to live, learn, work, and play; and deliver sustainable infrastructure for communities and the city's future economy.



NYCEDC is committed to offering competitive benefits to support employee health, happiness, and work-life balance. We offer comprehensive benefits and unique perks to ensure NYCEDC employees flourish in their professional and personal lives:



* Generous employer subsidized health insurance
* Medical, dental, and pharmacy plans
* Vision and hearing benefits
* Flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care
* Short term and long-term disability coverage
* 100% employer covered life insurance and supplemental life insurance coverage
* Up to 25 vacation days
* Floating Holidays and Summer Fridays
* Parental leave - up to 20 paid weeks
* Retirement savings programs
	+ Company-paid 401(a) defined contribution plan
	+ 457(b) tax-advantaged retirement savings plan
* Tuition Reimbursement program
* Continuing education and professional development
* Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) eligible employer
* College savings plan
* Backup childcare
* Gym membership discounts
* A Calm.com membership for mindfulness and mental health support
* Employee discounts through Plum Benefits, Student Loan Servicing tools, and much more


*Benefits listed above may vary based on the length and nature of your employment with New York City Economic Development Corporation. These benefits are subject to be modified at any time, at the discretion of the organization.*



The New York City Economic Development Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our Diversity, Equity, and Social Responsibility Mission is to create a People First strategy by attracting, retaining, and engaging a diverse and talented workforce. Like the city of New York, NYCEDC knows our strength comes from each of our connected parts, making the fabric of our organization better and stronger because of our unique employees' talents.



For more information, visit our website at edc.nyc.

title: Front Desk Associate
company: Retro Fitness of New City NY (Rockland County)
description:
PLEASE NOTE!!!!

We are located in New City, NY, in Rockland County, NOT New York City.

INTERVIEWS.

Please send a copy of your resume and bring one with you.

Our address is:

278 S Main St

New City, NY 10956

Below is a description of the job, so please take the time to familiarize yourself with what we require of the staff.

..................................................................................................................................................

The Front Desk employee is the face of the Retro Fitness outlet; they are the person a member sees when he or she first comes into the facility. It is important that this person is team oriented with great communications skills. The Front Desk employee wears many hats while also ensuring positive member experience.

Live by the Retro values- integRity, dEdication, consisTency, expeRience and inOvation! Requirements:

- The ability to multi-task.

-Customer service oriented.

-Punctual, responsible and pays attention to details.

- CPR/AED training preferred.

-Prior sales experience in a retail setting is preferred.

- Successful completion of all Retro University courses.

*Environment:*

- Working environment is inside the Retro Fitness Outlet.

- Working hours could vary and include mornings, evenings, and weekends.

*Direct report:*

- This position is supervised by Retro Fitness General and Assistant Manager

*Retro Fitness Mission Statement:*

Retro Fitness is a Health Club built on the respect and dedication for each of our members who entrust us to help them achieve their health and fitness goals. Our mission is to provide a consistent and innovative customer experience for each member to realize their true fitness potential; making America a healthier place 1 visit, 1 rep, 1 mile at a time.

*Responsibility of Front Desk Staff Member:*

- Responsibilities of Front Desk Staff Member.

- Greeting and checking in members as they come in.

-Resolving member issues in an effective manner.

-Membership sales and retention.

-Following up with prospects.

-Selling in-store merchandise such as Retro Blends Smoothies, Cooler drinks, Pro-shop items, etc. Ensuring a safe and clean environment for all members and staff.

Applicable downtime tasks provided by Management may include upkeep, cleaning & walk throughs of facility.

Following company policies and procedures.

All Front Desk employees are to wear company staff shirt along with their Khaki pants or black athletic pants. Sneakers must always be worn. No boots, heals, open toe shoes, slippers or Uggs. Front Desk Staff should always be well groomed and neat. Opening shifts employees are required to be inside the facility 15 minutes prior to scheduled opening time ensuring all items on the opening checklist are met before members arrive. Closing employees are to close the facility at the established time. Employees are not to count money until all members have left the Retro Fitness outlet and the doors have been locked.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $15.00 - $16.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Night shift

Work Location: In person

title: Commercial Counsel
description:
**Our mission: to eliminate every barrier to mental health.**



Spring Health is a comprehensive mental health solution for employers and health plans. Unlike any other solution, we use clinically validated technology called Precision Mental Healthcare to pinpoint and deliver exactly what will work for each person — whether that's meditation, coaching, therapy, medication, and beyond.



Today, Spring Health equips over 800 companies, from start-ups to multinational Fortune 500 corporations, as a leading and preferred mental health service. Companies like J.P. Morgan Chase & Co., Microsoft, J.B. Hunt, Bumble, and Instacart use the Spring Health platform to provide mental health services to thousands of their team members globally. We have raised over $370 million from prominent investors including Kinnevik, Tiger Global, Northzone, RRE Ventures, and many more. Thanks to their partnership, our current valuation has reached $2.5 billion.


The Commercial Counsel is an essential member of the legal and corporate compliance team, responsible for negotiating, drafting and reviewing various agreements on behalf of Spring Health. He or she will assist and partner with the legal team on a daily basis to assist with various contracting functions. The successful candidate must be agile, with a demonstrated ability to pivot and manage a workload properly and timely, and able to work as part of a close-knit team in a fast-paced environment of a highly regulated healthcare company.



In addition, the ideal candidate will exemplify Spring Health's values in their day-to-day work:



* Members come first: *We are genuine member advocates*


* Move fast to change lives: *We build with urgency and intention*


* Take ownership: *We extend trust and hold ourselves accountable*


* Embrace diverse teams and perspectives*: We find strength in diversity of cultural backgrounds, ideas, and experiences*


* Science will win: *We will achieve impact by innovation and evidence-based frameworks*


* Candor with care: *We are open, honest, and empathetic*



**Primary Responsibilities for Commercial Counsel:**


* Draft, review, and negotiate a wide range of contracts in support of Spring Health operations and services (which may include confidentiality agreements, consulting agreements, customer agreements and vendor services agreements).
* Work closely and partner with Sales, Strategic Alliances, Marketing, and Customer Success teams on transactions that drive the company's revenue and in support of our mission.
* Assist Customer Success with client contract administration processes, including handling requests, facilitating notices, tracking renewals, and ensuring appropriate execution of all legal documents.
* Support various teams in negotiations with vendors.
* Partner with internal stakeholders and subject matter experts (e.g., privacy, compliance, regulatory, data security, operations, etc.) throughout the contract process from request to execution. Ensure adherence to contract-related policies and procedures and help troubleshoot and resolve contract issues and challenges.
* Support continuous improvements of forms, policies and processes to help streamline, simplify and automate the contracting processes.


**Qualifications for Commercial Counsel:**


* Bar membership in good standing in any US state.
* 5+ years of legal experience, preferably advising fast-paced health tech or healthcare entities through various stages of growth, either as in-house or external counsel.
* Experience drafting and reviewing a wide variety of commercial contracts, including NDAs, technology, vendor agreements, and marketing agreements.
* Ability to expeditiously identify and assess issues, evaluate risk and provide legally sound recommendations consistent with good business practices and reason.
* Exceptionally strong business acumen and the ability to work effectively and efficiently on multiple projects in a busy work environment, while being a critical (and often autonomous) go-to partner for fellow peers in the company and legal department.
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability over assigned projects and tasks.
* High level of integrity, professionalism, intellectual curiosity, and willingness to grow.
* Exceptional organizational, project management, and prioritization skills.
* Outstanding written and oral communications skills.
* Ability to work with a wide variety of people, at all levels in the organization, in a hypergrowth environment.
* Maintain strict confidentiality of personnel data, proprietary information, and sensitive materials as required.


**What Success Looks Like in This Role:**


* You build strong working relationships with internal stakeholders, with a focus on collaborative problem solving.
* You meet and exceed internal metrics for responsiveness to Company priorities.
* You help empower the Company to make timely and informed decisions during contract negotiations to enable rapid growth.
* You proactively seek feedback and opportunities to be a better partner and advocate on behalf of the Company.


*The target base salary range for this position is* ***$184,000 - $230,000****, and is part of a competitive total rewards package including stock options and benefits. Individual pay may vary from the target range and is determined by a number of factors including experience, location, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We review all employee pay and compensation programs annually at minimum to ensure competitive and fair pay.*



Don't meet every requirement? Studies have shown that **women, communities of color and historically underrepresented** talent are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Spring Health **we are dedicated** to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we strongly encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!


**Ready to do the most impactful work of your life? Learn more about our values, how we work, and how hypergrowth meets impact at Spring Health:****Our Values**


**Hypergrowth meets impact**


**What to expect working here:**


* You will be held accountable to an exceptionally high bar and impact
* This may be the fastest work environment you will ever experience in terms of growth, decision-making, and time to impact
* You will be empowered to set your own boundaries and asked to adapt them in critical moments when the company needs you
* You will create processes & products that have never existed before
* You will have very direct conversations and receive continuous feedback to push you to become the most thriving team member and performer you can be
* Change is a constant here: your role, team, responsibilities, and success metrics will shift as the company grows


**And…**


* You get to be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the field
* You get to learn and grow at an extremely accelerated pace
* You will experience transparency, integrity, & humility from leadership
* You will be empowered to constantly challenge the status quo
* You get the space to experiment & innovate
* You get to make a transformational impact for the company, mental health, and for real human lives — and you will see that impact quickly
* You will become more resourceful and resilient
* You get to be part of a winning team that opens doors in the future


**Benefits provided by Spring Health:**


*Your Total Health:*

  

* Health, Dental, Vision benefits start on your first day at Spring Health. You and your dependents also receive an individual **One Medical**account which is valued at $199/year per user. HSA and FSA plans available
* A yearly allotment of no cost visits to the Spring Health network of therapists, coaches, and medication management providers for you and your dependents
* 10 allocated sick days per year
* Flexible paid time off in addition to 12 paid holidays throughout the year
* Access to **Gympass**, an on-demand virtual benefit that provides wellbeing coaching, and budget management.
* Spring Renewal: When you hit your four-year Springaversary, you'll be awarded afourweek**,** fullypaid**,** sabbatical leave to renew and recharge.


*You And Your family:*


* 4-4.5 months of fully paid parental leave
* Spring Health provides team members and their families with sponsored access to Bright Horizons® child care, back-up care, and elder care.
* Access to fertility care support through **Carrot**, in addition to $4,000 reimbursement for related fertility expenses


*Supporting you financially through:*


* Our People team benchmarks all salaries using the**Radford Global Compensation Database**for technology and life sciences industries. Radford benchmarks salaries with 3,589 global firms, 6.5 million employees, and 98 countries across the globe. We do this to ensure all of our team members are paid equally and competitively.
* On top of competitive and benchmarked salary, Spring Health offers incentive pay (based on role), and equity that begins vesting as we celebrate your first year with the company!
* Employer sponsored 401(k) match of up to 2% after 90 days of employment


*Creating a culture you can thrive in:*


* Flexible work arrangements: 66% of Spring Health team members work fully remote while 33% work in a hybrid model from our New York City offices
* Focus Fridays: no meetings, no distractions, just time for you to get work done.
* Focus Weeks: In Spring 2023, we held our first ever Focus Week, we canceled all non-essential meetings, minimized distractions, and you, our team members, to dive into the key work that gets chopped up or deprioritized during the regular day-to-day. We saw a 36% jump in the average energized score after those five days of flow state work and are finalizing a plan for quarterly Focus Weeks for team members.
* Up to $1,000 Professional Development Reimbursement per calendar year.
* $200 per year donation matching to support your favorite causes


***Our privacy policy:*** ***https://springhealth.com/privacy-policy/***



Don't meet every requirement? Studies have shown that **women, communities of color and historically underrepresented** talent are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Spring Health **we are dedicated** to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace



To ensure intentional and equitable hiring practices, we use a balanced candidate slate in our interviews. This approach **guarantees** that our pool of qualified candidates includes individuals who are **underrepresented** in our organization at *all levels.* This is a key performance indicator (KPI) for our recruiting and hiring teams, reported quarterly to maintain accountability.

***Our privacy policy:*** ***https://springhealth.com/privacy-policy/***


*Spring Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable legal requirements. Spring Health is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.*

* Numerous yearly no-cost visits to the Spring Health network of therapists, coaches, and medication management providers for you and your dependents
* 10 allocated sick days per year
* Flexible paid time off in addition to 12 paid holidays throughout the year
* Access to **Gympass**, an on-demand virtual benefit that provides wellbeing coaching, and budget management.
* Spring Renewal: When you hit your four-year Springaversary, you'll be awarded afourweek**,** fullypaid**,** sabbatical leave to renew and recharge.


*You And Your family:*


* 4-4.5 months of fully paid parental leave
* Spring Health provides team members and their families with sponsored access to Bright Horizons® child care, back-up care, and elder care.
* Access to fertility care support through **Carrot**, in addition to $4,000 reimbursement for related fertility expenses


*Supporting you financially through:*


* Our People team benchmarks all salaries using the**Radford Global Compensation Database**for technology and life sciences industries. Radford benchmarks salaries with 3,589 global firms, 6.5 million employees, and 98 countries across the globe. We do this to ensure all of our team members are paid equally and competitively.
* On top of competitive and benchmarked salary, Spring Health offers incentive pay (based on role), and equity that begins vesting as we celebrate your first year with the company!
* Employer sponsored 401(k) match of up to 2% after 90 days of employment


*Creating a culture you can thrive in:*


* Flexible work arrangements: 66% of Spring Health team members work fully remote while 33% work in a hybrid model from our New York City offices
* Focus Fridays: no meetings, no distractions, just time for you to get work done.
* Focus Weeks: In Spring 2023, we held our first ever Focus Week, we canceled all non-essential meetings, minimized distractions, and you, our team members, to dive into the key work that gets chopped up or deprioritized during the regular day-to-day. We saw a 36% jump in the average energized score after those five days of flow state work and are finalizing a plan for quarterly Focus Weeks for team members.
* Up to $1,000 Professional Development Reimbursement per calendar year.
* $200 per year donation matching to support your favorite causes

***Our privacy policy:*** ***https://springhealth.com/privacy-policy/***


*Spring Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Spring Health is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.*

title: Sales and Education Coordinator - NY Region
description:
**Who we are:**



Hi, we're Supergoop! Since 2005, we've been changing the way the world thinks about sunscreen. Today, we're as committed as ever to creating feel-good sunscreen that you'll really want to wear. Because protecting your skin's health is what we're all about. Every. Single. Day.™

 **Who You Are:**

You are a cosmetic industry leader who is exhilarated by the opportunity to build the Supergoop! brand and service approximately 80 doors to support our retail partners such as Sephora and Ulta witihin the Brooklyn, Queens, and Long Island area market. In this role you will use your strong social media and broadcast selling skills to drive retail through in person support, selling and coordinating successful events, and expanding brand awareness. You will report directly to the Regional Market Manager.


**Responsibilities:**


* You will lead by example by displaying the Supergoop! Core values.
* In partnership with your leader you will develop territory strategy to reach retailer sales targets and provide growth YOY, assuring focus on elevating the brand awareness to reach maximum ROI.
* Prepare weekly business insights and in-store activity recaps to the Sales and Education Manager that include business/product performance, market and competitive insight, etc.
* You will be adaptable and agile in your approach to the different retailers you work with by understanding their specific company culture.
* You will identify and work to resolve inventory, staffing, branding, or merchandising needs at the market level.
* You will ensure that each store is trained frequently and reinforce that training with follow up selling techniques, demonstrations, and product information
* You will develop and maintain an organized system that ensures appropriate levels of testers, gratis, sampling & training materials
* You will identify and report market information with leadership to ensure market growth
* You will execute Supergoop! marketing initiatives
* You will maintain Supergoop! image and highest possible standards by adhering to merchandising guidelines
* With the support of the Manager, create schedules for freelance Sun Specialists that will support current business strategy and needs. Monitor and approve payroll to ensure that budgets are fully utilized to deliver the best ROI.
* Take part in all major event set-up and execution, leading your Sun Specialists and setting the standard in delivering best in class education and sales.
* Build and maintain strong strategic partnerships with key leadership within our retail partner resulting in increased understanding of the business and achievement of successful sales results.


**Qualifications/Experience:**


* 1-2 years prior experience as a Market Coordinator or in the Beauty Sales & Education sphere
* This role is a client-facing position, expected to be in store 5 days a week, Tuesday-Saturday. Schedules to be determined by the needs of individual locations to ensure the highest ROI. Need for office days will be granted on an as needed basis.
* As we are a seasonal brand, there is a blackout period starting in Spring through Summer, with some flexibility to request time off. Dates vary every year and are determined by the Leadership team.
* Experience with, and understanding of our merchandiser's business (Sephora, Ulta, etc) is essential
* You have a passion for selling and exceeding goals and expectations and have demonstrated an ability to drive sales through fostering relationships and providing exceptional brand partnership
* Demonstration of creative and active problem-solving skills
* Ability to work in fast-paced, often-changing environment
* High-level attention to detail and accuracy in execution of work and tasks
* Proficient computer knowledge of Windows, Word, Excel, Google and PowerPoint
* Willingness to work out of home office on occasion
* Willing and able to travel overnight
* Fluency in social media and virtual programs
* Ability to lift and carry items weighing up to 50lbs
* Integrity is key to your success

  



Salary Range: $60,000 - $65,000 commensurate with experience


**Supergoop! shines bright for you and offers US based full-time employees:**
* Comprehensive Health Benefits
* Generous Paid Time Off Policy
* 401k with Company Match
* Product Discounts
* Employee Referral Program
* Company and Team Off-Sites


**EEO Statement:**



Supergoop! is dedicated to hiring a diverse workplace that celebrates an inclusive culture and a sense of belonging. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, gender expression, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, veteran status, genetic information or disability.



**Health and Safety Statement:**



The health and safety of you and the Supergoop! Team is important to us. Covid-19 vaccination will be required to work in our office.

title: Field Organizer
description:
**Field Organizer**

**Josh Gottheimer for Congress**

Northern New Jersey Member of Congress Josh Gottheimer’s campaign is seeking qualified candidates for the Field Organizer position. Josh Gottheimer is a Democratic Member of Congress representing New Jersey’s 5th Congressional District and co-chair of the bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus.

**Job Description**

The Field Organizer is responsible for executing the campaign's voter contact program. Reporting to the Field Director, they will recruit, train, and manage volunteers and interns to carry out voter outreach and mobilization.

Applicants must possess reliable transportation, a valid driver’s license, working laptop, and be willing to work extended hours and weekends.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Recruit and manage a team of volunteers, volunteer leadership, and interns.
* Train volunteers and interns on voter contact skills.
* Create a positive volunteer experience that engages new people in the volunteer process and keeps people engaged throughout the cycle.
* Set up volunteer events and coordinate with local campaigns.
* Execute direct voter contact including, canvassing, phone banking, and texting.

**Qualifications**

* Experience managing and training volunteers.
* Past success working in a team environment.
* Familiarity with Google Suite, Zoom, VAN and other online tools.
* Ability to meet deadlines and communicate progress towards meeting goals.
* Attention to detail.
* Campaign experience preferred.

**To Apply**: Please email your resume to Kurt Bond (kurt@josh4jersey.com)

with the subject line “Field Organizer Application”

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Schedule:

* Evenings as needed
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Commute:

* Paramus, NJ 07652 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Paramus, NJ 07652: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Veterinary Assistant
description:
Bond Vet is on a mission to strengthen the human-animal bond through better pet care. We offer primary and urgent care, so we're there for pets when they need us most. Our clinics are designed with pets and people in mind: warm, friendly, and highly sniffable. We balance this design with a strong focus on technology, all built in-house, which means we can easily innovate our systems to improve the veterinary team, pet, and client experience.

  

We're building the next generation of veterinary clinics from the ground up — and we're looking for a proactive Veterinary Assistant to join our team.


**The Opportunity:**



Our **Veterinary Assistants** partner with our Veterinarians and Vet Techs to deliver exceptional care to our pets and pet parents. You will provide a high level of compassion as you interact with our clients and support our cohesive teams in whatever is needed, from scribing during visits to assisting with procedures. You are efficient, detail oriented, and a collaborative team member who is passionate about providing quality care to pets!



This is a full time (40 hrs/week) position with a rotating schedule of four 10hr shifts per week.


### **What You'll Do:**


* Scribe for our Veterinarians during visits
* Support medical team members with surgeries, x-rays, treatments, and other procedures
* Compassionately handle and restrain pets for exams
* Record and report on patient symptoms
* Clean, restock and maintain clinic common areas and exam rooms
* Clearly communicate pricing estimates and treatment plans, serving as a guide through the client's visit experience
* Assist with client interactions, walk-ins, calls, scheduling, and client education as needed
* Perform other duties as assigned by your team leaders

### **You Have:**


* 1+ year of experience working as a veterinary assistant or kennel assistant
* A working knowledge of veterinary terminology
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* High attention to detail and ability to multitask with accuracy and efficiency
* A high proficiency for typing and utilizing multiple computer systems and capturing recommendations made during the course of a visit
* A passion for pets!

### **We Offer:**


* Competitive Pay | Based on Experience
* Opportunities for tuition assistance for staff pursuing LVT/CVT with our education partners
* Team-Based Profit Sharing
* Discount on In-Clinic Services for Pets
* Flexible Scheduling Models with scheduled released at least a month in advance
* Paid Parental Leave
* 401(k) contribution with partial employer match
* Support for your physical and mental wellness: medical, dental & vision plan options and access to mental health support programs
* A place to grow: culture that is centered in learning and development, career pathing, mentorships, empowerment and trust

  


**Our Values:**
**We're obsessed with pets:** The love we feel for animals drives us to do our best. We work with initiative, positivity and warmth to bridge the gap between human and pet, focusing on wellness to keep a better, stronger bond.
**We work as a team:** We're knowledgeable, friendly, and passionate about a better veterinary experience. We jump at the opportunity to help one another and seek out opportunities to team up on tasks. We're all in this together - our team, pet owners, and the animal - and our success as a team hinges on all of us doing our best.
**We communicate clearly:** We speak up, we do what we say, and we're transparent and honest. We value clear, simple communication.
**We work happy:** We bring a happy, positive attitude to work because it impacts the energy in the office.
**We're empowered:** We're building a new kind of vet experience, and every team member is empowered to try new things and own their decision-making.

*By submitting an application you agree to receive SMS messages from Bond Vet and third parties retained by Bond Vet regarding your application and interview process, including, but not limited to, your interviews, scheduling, offers, reference checks, background checks, and general communication throughout the process. Opt out anytime by messaging STOP. Msg & data rates may apply.*
  

*Bond Vet provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.*
company_description: Bond Vet is on a mission to strengthen the human-animal bond through better pet care. We’ve rebuilt the vet clinic from the ground up, with a focus on team happiness, growth, and development.

title: Part-Time Mobile Unit Driver/ Maintenance
description:
***Who is Bridging Access to Care, Inc.:*** *Bridging Access to Care, Inc. (BAC) is a nonprofit, multi-service, community-based behavioral health care organization committed to building healthy communities, one person at a time.*

*In 2012, Brooklyn Aids Task Force changed its name to BAC and successfully made the transition from an AIDS-centered organization to a multi-service community-based healthcare organization. Brooklyn Aids Task Force was the very first HIV/AIDS organization in Brooklyn prioritizing serving persons living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) since 1986. Today, BAC provides mental health and substance use-related social services, comprehensive HIV/AIDS care, and coordinated health care and supportive services to under-served racial and ethnic minority communities in the Brooklyn and other parts of New York City.*

*Bridging Access to Care, Inc. offers a competitive salary package, including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and opportunities for professional development.*

**JOB SUMMARY:**

BAC is looking for a **Mobile Unit Driver/ Maintenance** to join our dynamic team as we revolutionize mobile testing vehicle operations in the bustling city of New York! As part of our team, you'll have the thrilling responsibility of driving and maintaining cutting-edge mobile testing units throughout the city. You'll be ensuring the safety of our community by transporting vehicles to various locations and overseeing their cleanliness and maintenance.

**WORK EXPERIENCES:**

· Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience and be in good health.

**EDUCATION:**

Minimum High School Diploma or Equivalent

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

· Driving and maintaining mobile testing vehicles.

· Driving safely to and from destinations throughout New York City, also picking up and dropping off vehicles at pre-determined destinations.

· Must pass and complete BAC driver safety course.

· Manages the maintenance and cleanliness of the BAC vehicles.

· Oversees maintenance of Mobile Testing Units. This includes but it is not limited to the following.

· Determines condition of agency vehicle(s) by inspection before and after each use. Maintain daily inspection reports before and after vehicle use.

· Responsible for maintaining service schedules for all BAC vehicles and determining condition of BAC vehicles by inspection before and after use.

· Ensure the vehicle is filled with all appropriate daily supplies, such as toiletries, paper towels, sanitizer, water, gas, etc.

· Assess and determine the condition of all equipment and machinery and reports to the Director of Operations on any items that require repairs or replacement.

· Responsible for cleaning Mobile units, such as cleaning and sanitizing bathrooms thoroughly. Also, perform daily cleaning activities such “high-touched” surfaces such as counters, tabletops, doorknobs, handles, bathroom fixtures, toilets, etc. to help reduce the spread of COVID-19.

· Collect and dispose of trash.

· Processes maintenance request form for all maintenance and repair issues.

· Perform other relevant maintenance and cleaning duties as necessary.

· Continually Monitor vehicles at testing events to ensure peak performance of vehicle.

· Maintain inventory of supplies and equipment.

· Conduct Fire drills on the Mobile units monthly.

· Maintain a clean driving record and adhere strictly to all policies and procedures required by BAC.

· Perform other related duties as assigned

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:**

· Interpersonal and communication skills

· Self-starter, able to identify and complete tasks without direct instruction

· Good reasoning and problem-solving abilities

· Excellent time management and multitasking skills

· Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

· Knowledge of health and safety standards and safe handling of cleaning chemicals

· Proficiency in performing repairs, changing locks, etc.

· Ability to regularly lift 80 pounds

· Valid NYS driver’s license and clean driving record required

· Ability to read, write, understand and follow directions

Must be able to lift 60 pounds

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $23.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 20 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evenings as needed
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Experience:

* Maintenance: 2 years (Preferred)

Language:

* English speaking Haitian Creole (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Executive, Client Services
description:
**Job Title:** Client Services Executive


**Work Location:** NYC (Hybrid)


**Start Date**: ASAP

  



Recently named one of WorkLife's 50 Best Places to Work and one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies, Whalar Group is a global creator company on a mission to liberate the creative voice.



Creators are at the heart of everything we do! We are a curious, diverse team of 300 individuals around the world who are passionate about the Creator Economy. Our proximity, understanding, and trust of creators evolved into a first-of-its-kind creator ecosystem. Under Whalar Group, there are six companies: Whalar, a global creator agency; Whalar Talent,a full-service, 360° creator and talent management company; Foam, a suite of AI tools, templates, and services; Moby Ventures, creator-centric venture studio; Umi Games, a groundbreaking gaming studio; and The Lighthouse, an IRL campus for creators.


**About the role:**
-------------------



The Client Services Executive will build, cultivate and manage relationships directly with the diverse group of amazing creators on the Whalar roster. Working with top-tier brands on flawless campaign executions will help you grow in your role and get first-hand experience with the overall creator economy while receiving exceptional training from our tenured Client Services team. You will act as the central resource that brings in the right expertise at the right time!


**Here's what you'll do day-to-day:**
-------------------------------------


* Social Media: Operate with creators on multiple platforms to include Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Snapchat and more (especially new, emerging platforms).
* Influencer Management: Source, negotiate, contract and manage creators across multiple campaign projects
* Creative Briefing: Issue creator facing briefs and lead day-to-day communications for content development and launch in market and build strong relationships
* Content Review & Quality Control: Work closely with the Campaign Manager to give feedback and approve on all creator content. Tasks include compliance checks for FCC protocol, IP, alignment with brief and more.
* Campaign Performance: Work closely with the Manager on overall campaign management, data capture and wrap reports
* Miscellaneous Team Support: Ensure campaigns and day-to-day operations run smooth and adhere to timelines to include all administrative tasks

**Here's what we're looking for:**
----------------------------------


* Experience in the general influencer landscape (1-3 years)
* An affinity for social media, content creators and/or experience is a plus!
* Strong communication, organization and interpersonal skills
* A creative & curious mindset and a can-do attitude
* Be a team player, willing to roll their sleeves up and dive in

  


*This hybrid role, based in Hudson Yards, NY, offers flexibility and collaboration, allowing you to choose any three days a week to work from our vibrant office. Enjoy a collaborative environment with top-tier amenities, including beverages, snacks, and weekly happy hours, fostering productivity and camaraderie. This position combines the best of both worlds, offering the freedom to balance in-office interactions with remote work flexibility*


*The salary range for this role is $50,000 - $55,000. This salary band serves as a general guideline reflecting the potential compensation for this role. The final salary offer will be determined based on a comprehensive evaluation of factors such as the candidate's experience, expertise, alignment with the position's requirements, and ultimately budget approvals.*


**Our values:**
---------------



At Whalar Group, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) isn't just a statement, it's our collective strength. Our people are our superpower. A diverse team and inclusive leadership have shaped Whalar Group since our inception in 2016, fueling a constant evolution of growth. We champion a culture of respect and empathy, fostering a sense of belonging that transcends demographics. We hire individuals of all backgrounds and empower them to thrive, challenge stereotypes, and actively break societal barriers. Learn more.


**The perks:**
--------------



Whalar Group provides flexible benefits and collaborative work environments and experiences so employees can work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs.


* Medical, Dental, Vision
* 25 days of PTO + Sick days + Winter break
* Retirement planning with employer match
* Monthly phone/internet reimbursement
* Professional development stipend
* New joiner Home office allowance
* Fertility benefits
* Up to 16 weeks of paid parental leave
* *Calm* App subscription (Add up to 4 dependents)
* Volunteer days
* Identity theft protection & Legal assistance
* Company Paid Life & Disability Insurance
* Extra Voluntary Life Insurance Policy
* Voluntary Hospital and Critical Illness Insurance
* Voluntary Pet insurance
* Employee Resource Groups


*Whalar Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Equal opportunity extends to all aspects of the employment relationship, including hiring, promotions, training, working conditions, compensation, and benefits.*

title: Performance Marketing Manager (Paid Media)
description:
If this role is right for you, send your resume to:


Loren.gould@ezra.com**Our mission**


Our mission at Ezra is to detect cancer early for everyone in the world. We have developed a new way to screen for cancer everywhere in the body using a full body MRI powered by Artificial Intelligence.


‍


We believe in empowering people to make their own health decisions, so we are offering Ezra as a direct-to-consumer membership. Our members sign up for Ezra, visit a partner imaging center to get a full body MRI scan, and receive a cancer screening report within 5-7 business days. Our scans and reports are all supported by AI.


‍

**Your mission**


We’re looking for a highly analytical and proactive Paid Performance Marketing Manager to join the Growth team. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a strong ability to source and analyze data, drive impactful data-driven marketing strategies and optimize our primary acquisition channels: Meta and Google paid search. You’ll also be responsible for implementing tests in a range of new paid digital channels.


‍


As the Paid Performance Marketing Manager at Ezra, you will lead and deliver:


‍

* **Strategy Development:** Develop, implement, and manage comprehensive performance D2C marketing strategies across paid social, paid search and other test channels to drive customer acquisition and retention.
* **Campaign Management:** Oversee the creation, execution, and optimization of campaigns, ensuring alignment with Ezra’s goals and brand standards.
* **Data Analysis:** Source, analyze, and interpret performance data to generate actionable insights. Utilize these insights to optimize campaigns, improve ROI, and drive strategic decision-making.
* **Budget Management**: Allocate and manage marketing budgets effectively across channels, ensuring maximum efficiency and performance.
* **Performance Tracking:** Monitor, track, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of marketing efforts, and provide regular updates to stakeholders.
* **A/B Testing:** Conduct A/B tests to optimize ad creative, targeting, and bidding strategies, ensuring continuous performance improvement.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with the wider growth team on multi-channel campaigns, as well as with the product and engineering teams to refine our product offering.
* **Market Research:** Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging digital marketing technologies to keep Ezra at the forefront of performance marketing.


‍

**Requirements:**


‍

* **Experience:** Minimum of 4-5 years of experience in D2C performance marketing, specifically with Meta (Facebook, Instagram) and Google paid search. Health Tech or other regulated industry experience is preferred but not mandatory.
* **Analytical Skills:** Strong analytical skills with the ability to source, interpret, and act on data. Proficiency in GA4, Looker, PowerBI, is a must.
* **Technical Skills:** Experience with marketing automation tools, CRM systems, and data visualization tools. Proficiency in Excel and/or other data analysis software.
* **Communication:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present data-driven insights clearly and persuasively.
* **Problem-Solving:** Proven ability to think critically and solve problems creatively and effectively.
* **Initiative:** Self-starter with a proactive approach to sourcing and analyzing data, driving continuous improvement and innovation.
* **Adaptability:** Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


‍

**What’s in it for you?**


As the Performance Marketing Manager at Ezra, you have the opportunity to be part of a small, all-star team focused on detecting cancer early for everyone in the world. You’re also going to have access to benefits such as:


‍

* Competitive salary
* Stock options
* Remote-friendly (2 days a week in person at our NYC office)
* Off-sites twice a year
* Competitive vacation policy
* A culture that emphasizes learning and work-life harmony


‍

**Our commitment to diversity and inclusion**


We’re aiming to build a diverse team and inclusive company culture. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.


‍


Salary: $70,000 - $120,000

title: 3D Designer
description:
A 3D Designer utilizes 3D design tools, i.e. AutoCAD 3D, Revit, etc. to create detailed 3D designs and 2D extraction packages. The Designer has knowledge in the capture and creation of point clouds and utilizes them within the design process as an aid for model creation as well as initial concept overlay all the way to as-built verification. The Designer requires knowledge in navigating and creating collaborative model document repositories. The Designer must be able to work with a team which is gaining 3D design experience and be able to aid as required. Staying up to date on the latest 3D technologies is required. #LI-AH1


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Under the guidance of a Senior Designer, the designer (Electrical, Mechanical or Civil/Structural) prepares preliminary sketches and/or schematic diagrams/wiring diagrams/block diagrams, cable & conduit schedules/flow diagrams/equipment layouts/foundation details/plan and profiles/structural details/P&IDs/bill of materials, etc. specific to their design discipline
* Responsible for drawings of components, systems and structures which are done in collaboration with other designers and CADD Operators to develop final design and construction packages
* Field verification through site inspections may be required to confirm existing design information reflects actual field conditions,
* Requires skills in a design discipline and knowledge of construction techniques
* Utilize the Document Management System to perform the design work
**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**
-----------------------------------


* Experience in a design discipline to prepare and review design drawings
* Familiarity with generally accepted design & drafting practices.
* Use of Computer Aided Design & Drafting software is preferred.
* Ability to clearly communicate design details
* Working Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite

title: IT Product Manager
description:
At NYPA, we are actively leading the charge towards New York’s clean energy future, making strategic investments in tools and technology capabilities to power the clean energy transformation. The IT Product Manager will support these efforts.

  


The IT Product Manager will work in close collaboration with Business Stakeholders, to guide the development and implementation of technology (tools & services); shifting innovative technology ideas into operational reality. They will establish strong relationships with Business Product Owners to understand Business objectives, provide guidance and direction on how technology can help the Business reach its’ goals, and translate Business Product Owners’ vision into Product Roadmaps.

  


The IT Product Manager will ensure alignment between the Business and IT, ensure execution of efficient processes, evaluate costs, and champion effective governance.

  

For success in this role the IT Product Manager will need a good understanding of IT tools, trends & concepts; work experience in IT product management (or closely related, transferrable area); a strong ability to develop trusting relationships; and the ability to influence without formal authority. They will need to motivate project teams, use creative problem solving, and demonstrate a high degree of emotional intelligence.

  

As the technology landscape continues to evolve, the IT Product Manager should have a strong desire for continuous learning, with a focus on continuous improvement, exhibiting resilience, curiosity and a positive outlook.

  


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Lead the design process of complex digital product deployment plans, working with all functions including the Digital Transformation Office, and other enterprise functions (internal and external Centers of Excellence) to ensure proper business direction and solutions to realize the Digital Utility objectives.
* Provide guidance on the techniques and tools to use and achieve product goals on time and on cost, while managing product risk.
* Act as escalation point for key product issues.
* Provide input into recommendations for resource allocation across Functional Organizations to achieve product objectives.
* Establish key relationships with internal constituents including the Digital Transformation Office, and other enterprise functions (internal and external Centers of Excellence) to ensure proper business direction and solutions to realize the Digital Utility objectives.
* Provide input into the rationalization of product portfolios and prioritization of investments to improve efficiency.
* Monitor product O&M and Capital spend to ensure planned resources are available to meet product goals.
* Develop and plan resource allocation and distribution, including employees, equipment, and other resources.
**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**
-----------------------------------


* Knowledge of business re-engineering principles and processes.
* Ability to analyze the current IT environment to detect critical deficiencies and be able to recommend solutions for improvement.
* Understanding of business goals and objectives as they relate to customer use cases and solutions.
* Able to develop an implementation plan for product development/integration based on business requirements and I.T. strategies.
* Understanding of the IT Industry trends and tools as they apply to NYPA business and processes.
* Able to balance the long-term ("big picture") and short-term implications of individual decisions.
* Ability to identify and implement practical technical solutions within acceptable business value parameters and cost/benefit determinations.
* Knowledge of agile and waterfall product development, DevOps and SDLC methodologies/framework.
**Education, Experience and Certifications**
--------------------------------------------


* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience required.
* May require certifications and licensures needed to meet Energy industry, federal, state, or local regulations.
* Minimum 6 years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and experienceStrong knowledge of change management principles.
**Physical Requirements**
-------------------------



The New York Power Authority is committed to providing fair, competitive, and market-informed compensation. The target salary range for this position is: $118,920.00 - $148,000.00. The salary offered will be determined based on the successful candidates’ relevant experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities.

title: Retail Stocking Supervisor
description:
A Supervisor (full-time) is a valued member of a high performing team who is empowered & equipped to do their job. You will know why your work matters and be able to take pride in what you do! This role is perfect for you if you have recent leadership experience and are passionate about a career in retail.  

  

The anticipated rate for this position is $23.25 per hour depending on location, knowledge, skills, education and experience. This position is also eligible for a monthly bonus. In addition, we offer comprehensive and competitive benefits to Associates (and their families) such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability. Eligible Associates are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan. Associates will accrue paid time off up to 152 hours per year (inclusive of PTO, floating holidays, and paid holidays). Paid sick time up to 64 hours per year unless otherwise required by law.  

  

Respectful schedules during operating hours of 6am-10pm.  

  

**Why You’ll Love it:*** People First Culture
* Respectful scheduling
* Paid time off
* Bonus opportunity
* Associate Discounts
* Company Matched 401(K)
* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
* Additional Benefits including HAS, discounted gym membership, EAP and more!
* Closed on Thanksgiving, Christmas & Easter
* Clear path to promotion & continuous leadership development
* Stable employment with growing company

**What You’ll Do:*** Ensure and model professional customer service
* Maintain a safe, clean, and organized store
* Cross-train in all areas of store operations including Stocking/Sales associate duties, and responsibilities
* Lead, coach, and develop others
* Serve as Leader on Duty as scheduled
* Other duties as assigned

**Requirements**


**Who You Are:*** Must be at least 18 years old.
* 1 year experience in retail leadership role.
* Ability to communicate clearly with customers and associates in person, e-mail, and telephone.
* Ability to intermittently lift, push and/or pull up to 50 pounds, and stand/move for entire shift.
* Ability to lift, bend, kneel, climb, crawl and/or twist, and safely climb up/down a ladder.
* Physically able and willing to become certified to operate a forklift in accordance with IIPP. (Injury, and Illness Prevention Program)
* Open availability with the ability to work evenings, weekends, and holidays. Adherence to attendance policy is necessary.
**About Harbor Freight Tools**


We’re a 45 year-old, $8 billion national tool retailer with the energy, enthusiasm, and growth potential of a start-up. We have over 1,500 stores in 48 states across the country and are opening several new locations every week. We offer our customers more than 7,000 tools and accessories, from hand tools and generators to air and power tools, from shop equipment to automotive tools. We provide our customers with the right tool for the right job at the right price, always delivering quality and value.

Full Time

title: Customer Success Associate
description:
Are you passionate about being at the forefront of the ever-evolving social advertising industry? Do you take pride in driving retention and growth among valued customers by understanding their business needs and helping them succeed?



We're looking for a dynamic Customer Success Associate to join us, as part of our growing Enterprise Customer Success team, in our mission to help advertisers unlock greater performance and creativity in social advertising by combining ad buying and creative automation.



As a Customer Success Associate at Smartly, you will work together with our Customer Success Managers to help manage a growing book of business in North America and take ownership of projects to support driving adoption and outcomes leading to advocacy, expansion and renewals across our customer portfolio in the region. You will also get to collaborate with our partners like Facebook, Pinterest and Snapchat as well as our Product and Engineering teams. You look forward to being part of a team of Humble Hungry Hunters dedicated to helping customers grow and get the most value out of their social advertising, delivering world-class support, challenging the status quo and building solutions for business needs and outcomes.


**As a Customer Success Associate at Smartly, you will...**
-----------------------------------------------------------


* Collaborate with the Customer Success team in the region to deliver an exceptional customer experience and ensure our customers get the most value out of their social advertising
* Develop yourself in building and maintaining relationships, while working to mitigate churn and drive engagement and renewals
* Become an expert in the Smartly platform and social advertising in general so as to be able to continuously solve problems for customers and provide best practices and consultative advice
* Collaborate effectively with our partners and across our internal functions including Sales, Marketing, Technical Solutions, Services, Product and Engineering
* Help gather feedback from our customers to inform our sales process and product roadmap
* Help Smartly build a world-class Customer Success organization; contribute to build a library of knowledge that differentiates us from competitors and helps win and retain customers, optimize existing processes within the company and actively enhance all Customer Success initiatives

**We are looking for you if you...**
------------------------------------


* Have a passion for customer success and online advertising and keeping up with the ever-changing ecosystem
* Are highly empathetic, with a positive attitude and a strong desire to help our customers reach their goals
* Have a results-driven mentality, with a bias for action and collaboration
* Are able to explain complex concepts clearly and translate data into insights
* Have strong spoken and written communication skills in English
* Are able and willing to travel for meetings, conferences and industry events

**Perks and Benefits...**
-------------------------


* Five weeks paid time off (PTO), 11 company paid holidays, unlimited sick days
* Generous healthcare packages & mental health benefits
* Monthly wellness benefit and learning reimbursement opportunities
* 401K plus matching & equity grants for all new Smartlies
* Volunteer time off days & company donation matching opportunities
* Choice of computer (MAC or PC)
* And so much more…


The base pay range for this position is as mentioned below per year, plus annual bonus. We take into consideration an individual's background, expertise, and experience in determining final salary. In addition to annual salary, Smartly's total rewards provide employees with stock options, medical/dental/vision insurance, retirement savings benefits, parental leave, 5 weeks vacation, unlimited sick days, life insurance and disability benefits. To learn more visit https://www.smartly.io/careers#our-benefits. This information is provided in accordance with applicable law. Base pay information is based on market location. Salary in USD : $60,000 - $70,000



#LI-HYBRID



#LI-BAILEY

**Meet Smartly**
----------------



Smartly is the AI-powered advertising technology company transforming ad experiences for brands and their consumers. Our comprehensive advertising platform seamlessly integrates the capabilities of media, creative, and intelligence to power more than 800 billion impressions and generate more than 300 billion creatives annually, delivering tangible business outcomes for brands and advertisers. We are the only company managing creative and media for 700+ brands worldwide and $5B in ad spend across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Google, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap, and TikTok. Our end-to-end technology, unmatched access to media platforms and exceptional customer service help Fortune 500 brands to reach and engage consumers and learn what performs best.  

  

Smartly is a multinational and diverse team of 650+ Smartlies from 60+ nationalities, working in 13 countries. Together, we want to create and maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and heard. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach is at the heart of it.



Visit Smartly.io to learn more.

title: Agency Customer Success Lead
description:
Smartly has an exciting new opportunity for an Agency Customer Success Lead to join our growing team! Your role will be to lead and manage the Agency Customer Success team based in New York, London and Berlin and own the existing agency revenue across NorAm and EMEA.



Leading a team of Customer Success Managers and reporting to the Director of Customer Success you will be responsible for retaining, nurturing and growing our existing agency customers across North America and EMEA. You will partner closely with our Agency Sales team and Agency Onboarding team to onboard new agency customers and expand Smartly.io's footprint within strategic enterprise agencies globally by building upon a strong foundation of value. As such, understanding how both agencies and the platforms work is a must.


**As an Agency Customer Success Lead at Smartly.io, you will...**
-----------------------------------------------------------------


* Lead a team of CSMs accountable for our agency revenue and relationships of enterprise strategic agencies
* Support team members to deepen relationships with agency customers and ensure customer satisfaction
* Act as escalation point for agency customers and point of contact for senior agency stakeholders to ensure alignment in goals
* Work closely with our digital advertising partners to grow agency customers and find new opportunities
* Coach team to increase product adoption, champion product improvements and help drive them to launch, together with our product management, product marketing and engineering teams
* Drive agency growth, partnering with Agency Sales and Onboarding team to expand agency relationships and accelerate onboarding of new agency clients
* Embody the Smartly.io values and play a lead role to ensure the culture engages employees, resonates locally and is consistent globally

**We're definitely looking for you, if you have...**
----------------------------------------------------


* 7+ years of sales/account management/customer success roles experience in ad-tech/mar-tech industries; experience with Facebook, Pinterest, Snap and other Social Media Platforms is a plus
* 3+ years management experience preferred
* Understand and have sold SaaS offerings, managed services, and professional services for agency customers
* Ability to build connections and engage confidently with a variety of audiences, including C-level decision makers, and ideally have strong agency contacts
* Strong desire to learn about the product in order to effectively sell up to the C-suite or down to end users as needed
* Able and willing to travel for meetings, conferences and industry events

**Perks & Benefits…**

* Five weeks paid time off (PTO), 11 company paid holidays, unlimited sick days
