* RN (Preferred)

  



Work Location: In person

title: Program Management Office Manager
description:
Great American Media is home to the family-friendly portfolio of brands Great American Family, Great American Faith & Living, and Great American Pure Flix. We are dedicated to our audience, and we believe that strong brands and high-quality programming create an unparalleled fan experience across the Great American Media portfolio.

We're looking for a growth-centric **PMO Manager** to help us achieve our mission of becoming the best. **Ideal candidates will be able to work a hybrid schedule at our Scottsdale, AZ office, New York City office or Texas Headquarters in DFW** (typically 3 days onsite, 2 days remote). Some travel may be required.

Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer, the PMO Manager drives the planning and execution of the Great American Media technology team efforts while establishing operational standard methodologies, process, procedure, and governance across the company. **This leadership role requires an individual with relevant industry experience in Project/Program Management (media technology industries)**, and staff management experience to develop and lead departmental staff and work in a collaborative style while building strong cross-functional partnerships driving organizational accountability to meet the company's goals.

The PMO Manager will directly lead large cross-functional initiatives in partnership with Engineering, Acquisitions, Operations, & Contracted Technology partners. This role engages with all teams and functional leads to define, prioritize, execute, and track project milestones, resources, and budget allocations across the platforms.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

* Champion best practices in Program Management including the use of new tools and resources, standardized across the company, to achieve project and product deliverables and milestones.
* Cultivate a best-in-class PMO governance process across the Product and Operations portfolio.
* Lead linear and digital media cross-functional initiatives in partnership with Engineering, Acquisitions, Operations, & Technology partners.
* Support Operational and Technical teams at the project level when challenges arise ensuring consistency across all product platforms.
* Drive accountability for Project team performance.
* Drive cross functional alignment and communication to ensure support for approved projects.
* Promote cross-discipline synergy for operational systems and processes at enterprise level by leading or collaborating key strategic areas: Technology, Acquisitions, Operations and Marketing.
* Engage with all teams as a functional lead to define, prioritize, execute, and track project milestones, resources, and budget allocations across the platforms.
* Facilitate best practices and lessons learned post product launch in order to drive Product portfolio and Operations continuous improvement opportunities.
* Other projects and responsibilities as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in business, project management, or related field, or equivalent working experience.
* 7+ years of successful experience with Operations, and Project Management or related functions in Business Management, Software Engineering, Video, Movie or VOD Platforms.
* Demonstrated success defining and managing large, complex projects in a linear/digital media environment using engineering resources and in compliance with specifications and testing environments.
* Demonstrated experience with PM Tools, reporting and integration.
* Strong business acumen with a broad understanding of fundamental business principles
* Experience leading PMO governance processes including process creation, feature/product planning management, resource management, and execution.
* Experience managing and building teams, including strong leadership of both matrixed teams and direct reports.
* Excellent oral and written communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Strong interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and build a consensus in a high-pressure environment.

**Compensation & Benefits**

Competitive base salary commensurate with experience. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:

* 401(k) retirement plan with employer match
* Employer paid medical, dental and vision insurance
* Employer paid STD and LTD
* Employer paid life insurance and AD&D plus voluntary supplemental options
* Pet Insurance
* Comprehensive paid time off – vacation, sick leave and holidays

We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Sales Effectiveness Coordinator
description:
**Duties/Responsibilities:**  

* Monitor community office management coverage and support field sales managers to provide adequate coverage for the community offices
* Oversee all community offices inventories to replenish the supplies including kitchen condiment, marketing collateral and site display
* Monitor daily production call- in and support the field Sales managers to evaluate weekly and monthly production report to recommend coaching methods based on relevant evaluation data
* Work hand in hand with the field Sales managers to provide supporting documentations for coaching memo
* Work with Sales Engagement manager to conduct refresher training on Salesforce, Eckoh, Twilio, NowPow, etc., as needed. Support and review refresher training materials and job aids
* Coordinate with stakeholders to identify, develop and implement effective refresher training curriculums
* Conduct weekly BOB auditing for enrollment submission
* Collaborate with PHSP team lead to improve member experience by assisting field sales manager to facilitate quality improvement coaching based on application auditing result
* Work with cross functional department stakeholders on various internal projects deployment support and processes
* Recommend and implement improvements as well as develop business processes to optimize current field operations workflow for PHSP growth team
* Other duties as assigned

* High School Diploma or GED Equivalent
* Proficient in Microsoft Office
* Good coaching skill
* Minimum 5 years field experience on management
* Must be able to handle multiple tasks with a proactive, flexible approach to all field reps back on their availability schedule
* Experience using Microsoft word including formatting, copy/pasting and using grammar/spell check.
* Excel or other spreadsheet software experience to create information reports requiring the use of edit, sort/filter and format data/print range
* Communicate effectively verbally and in writing while demonstrating good grammar, spelling and punctuation skills.

**All Other Locations (within approved locations):** $59,800 - $88,910
  
  

As a candidate for this position, your salary and related elements of compensation will be contingent upon your work experience, education, licenses and certifications, and any other factors Healthfirst deems pertinent to the hiring decision.
  
  

In addition to your salary, Healthfirst offers employees a full range of benefits such as, medical, dental and vision coverage, incentive and recognition programs, life insurance, and 401k contributions (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Healthfirst believes in providing a competitive compensation and benefits package wherever its employees work and live.

title: Assistant Nurse Manager
description:
**Job Description: Assistant Nurse Manager**

**Location:** New York, NY

**Overview:** We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Assistant Nurse Manager to join our healthcare team in New York City. The Assistant Nurse Manager will play a crucial role in supporting the Nurse Manager in overseeing daily operations, ensuring high-quality patient care, and maintaining a positive work environment for nursing staff.

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist the Nurse Manager in managing the nursing unit or department effectively.
* Supervise and coordinate nursing staff, including assigning duties, providing guidance, and evaluating performance.
* Ensure adherence to hospital policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
* Collaborate with healthcare professionals to ensure seamless patient care and interdisciplinary communication.
* Participate in hiring, training, and mentoring nursing staff.
* Handle patient care issues and escalate as needed to the Nurse Manager or appropriate personnel.
* Manage scheduling, staffing, and resource allocation to maintain optimal patient care levels.
* Foster a supportive and collaborative work environment that promotes professional growth and teamwork among staff members.
* Assist in developing and implementing quality improvement initiatives to enhance patient outcomes and satisfaction.
* Maintain accurate documentation and records related to nursing activities and patient care.

**Qualifications:**

* Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of New York.
* Bachelor’s degree in Nursing (BSN) required; Master’s degree in Nursing or related field preferred.
* Proven experience as a charge nurse, team leader, or in a supervisory nursing role.
* Strong leadership and managerial skills with the ability to mentor and motivate a diverse team.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of healthcare regulations and standards.
* Critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities effectively.
* CPR certification and other relevant certifications as required.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
* Comprehensive healthcare benefits package.
* Retirement savings plan (401k) with employer match.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* Professional development opportunities.

title: Truck Loader
description:
**Truck Loader Job Summary**

The qualified candidate will wrap and move pallets of products from within the warehouse and carefully load them onto trucks in the proper sequence and staging. This is a physically demanding job. Attention to detail is essential. Qualified candidates must be able to stand, squat, reach, and bend throughout the duration of the shift, as well as lift up to 50 lbs. regularly.

**Truck Loader Duties and Responsibilities:**

· Move pallets using pallet jacks

· Load trucks efficiently according to a pallet map without damaging products

· Review each load and properly document after you have finished each load

· Ability to keep work area safe and clean

· Perform other duties as assigned by area supervisor or management

**Requirements and Qualifications**:

· Ability to stand, squat, reach, and bend on a regular basis throughout the shift

· Ability to work in different temperature zones throughout the shift

· Ability to lift up to 50 pounds regularly

This position offers competitive pay and opportunities for growth within our organization. If you are a motivated individual with the necessary skills, we encourage you to apply for the position of Truck Loader.

title: Event Sales Associate
description:
**Job Overview:** The Roger Sherman Inn, a historic and elegant venue located in New Canaan, CT, is seeking a dynamic and motivated Events/Banquets Sales Associate. This position plays a vital role in driving sales and ensuring the successful planning and execution of events and banquets. This includes Weddings, Baby Showers, Corporate Events etc. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in sales and event coordination, exceptional customer service skills, and a passion for creating memorable experiences for our clients.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Sales and Business Development:**

* Proactively seek out new business opportunities and generate leads for events and banquets.
* Develop and maintain relationships with prospective and existing clients.
* Conduct site visits and tours for potential clients, showcasing the venue’s features and amenities.
* Prepare and present proposals, negotiate contracts, and close sales

**Event Coordination:**

* Collaborate with clients to understand their event requirements and preferences.
* Plan and coordinate all aspects of events, including weddings, corporate functions, social gatherings, and banquets.
* Work closely with the culinary and service teams to ensure seamless execution of events.
* Create detailed event timelines and floor plans.

**Client Relationship Management:**

* Provide exceptional customer service throughout the planning process and during events.
* Address client inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally.
* Ensure client satisfaction and foster long-term relationships.

**Marketing and Promotion:**

* Develop and implement marketing strategies to promote the venue and attract event bookings.
* Utilize social media, email campaigns, and other marketing channels to reach target audiences.
* Participate in networking events, trade shows, and community activities to increase brand awareness.

**Administrative Tasks:**

* Maintain accurate records of client interactions, contracts, and event details.
* Prepare sales reports and forecasts for management review.
* Assist with invoicing and payment collection.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management, Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field (preferred).
* 3-5+ proven experience in sales, event planning, or hospitality management.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
* Ability to multitask and manage multiple events simultaneously.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and event management software.
* Creative problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends as required.

**Benefits:**

* Health, Dental Insurance
* PTO
* Employee discounts at the inn and restaurant.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement.

Salary:

50,000- 65,000 Annually + Aggressive Commission Structure.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Experience:

* Events management: 1 year (Preferred)
* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

title: Operator-in-Training
description:
**Reports to:** Operations Supervisor
  

Project Manager
  

Project Director
  

  

**Supervises:** None  

  

  

  

**General Statement**  

Performs a variety of tasks in the operation and maintenance of a wastewater treatment plant on
  

an assigned shift. This position typically holds or is working on first level wastewater treatment
  

certification. An NJDEP S1 Operators License will need to be obtained within the first two
  

years of employment with CH2M HILL.  

  

  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**   

Learns and gains skills involving the maintenance of equipment and servicing work in


the plant
   

Operates treatment facilities to control flow and processing of water/wastewater, sludge,


and effluent
   

Operates valves and gates either manually or by remote control, starts and stops pumps,


engines and generators to control and adjust flow and treatment processes
   

Monitors gauges, meters, and control panels
   

Observes and reports abnormalities to supervisor
   

Maintains shift log and records meter and gauge readings
   

Collects samples and performs routine laboratory tests and analyses
   

Performs routine maintenance functions and custodial duties
   

Understands and carries out oral and written directions
   

Assists in keeping maintenance records using a CMMS system, develop computer


spreadsheets, and use Word and Excel
   

Ability to read and interpret construction plans, prints, specifications and Operations and


Maintenance Manuals
   

Establishes and maintains cooperative relationships with those contacted during the


course of work
   

Performs other duties as required
   

Performs Job Hazard Analysis

  



**Basic Qualifications**   

High school diploma or GED
   

Possess a valid driver’s license
  

  

**Preferred Qualifications**   

Basic familiarity of the principles and practices of water/wastewater treatment plant


operations; operating principles of valves, pumps, and motors; principles and methods of
  

bacteriological and chemical sewage analyses; effects and problems of industrial waste in
  

water/wastewater treatment processes; safe work practices
 

Knowledge or previous experience in water or wastewater treatment and operations
   

Knowledge of SCADA, PLC and VFD systems
   

Has applicable OSHA training including but not limited to Confined Space Entry and


Lockout/Tag out procedures
   

Has obtained the NJDEP S1 Operators License
  

  

**Working Conditions & Physical Requirements**  

The work area can involve a working environment indoors as well as outdoors, which could
  

cause exposure to outdoor elements; proper environmental attire will be required. Some areas
  

can have loud noise, active machinery, high pressure fluid systems, electrical equipment,
  

confined spaces, heights and depths, fumes, air borne particles, noxious gases, pathogens and
  

various chemicals. The use of appropriate safety equipment will be mandatory in these areas to
  

prevent hazardous contact.
  

  

Must be able to sit, stand, stoop, twist and bend at the waist, turn, kneel, squat, raise arms above
  

shoulder height, grasp, reach, perform repetitive hand movements and fine coordination to work
  

on equipment, have vision sufficient to service equipment, have hearing in the normal range with
  

or without correction. In an 8-hour shift must be able to transport self across the facility**,** ascend
  

and descend stair steps, lift objects up to 50 pounds from floor level to waist height, push a push-  

type mower; wear and use appropriate safety equipment.
